unnormalised: Subject: My Journey with Yoga: From Gym Rat to Peaceful Yogi
normalised: Subject: My Journey with Yoga: From Gym Rat to Peaceful Yogi

unnormalised: Okay, so I'll admit it, I used to be *that* person who scoffed at yoga. I was all about lifting heavy weights at the gym, thinking it was the only way to get fit. I was hitting the gym 6 days a week, religiously, since 2018. Then, one day my doctor, Dr. Sharma in Lucknow, suggested I try yoga to help with my chronic back pain. He recommended a local yoga center near my house.
normalised: Okay, so I will admit it, I used to be *that* person who scoffed at yoga. I was all about lifting heavy weights at the gym, thinking it was the only way to get fit. I was hitting the gym six days a week, religiously, since two thousand and eighteen. Then, one day my doctor, Doctor Sharma in Lucknow, suggested I try yoga to help with my chronic back pain. He recommended a local yoga center near my house.

unnormalised: Initially, I was resistant. I thought, "Yoga? That's just stretching!" But my back pain was getting unbearable, and I was tired of popping painkillers. So, I reluctantly signed up for a beginner's class.
normalised: Initially, I was resistant. I thought, "Yoga? That is just stretching!" But my back pain was getting unbearable, and I was tired of popping painkillers. So, I reluctantly signed up for a beginner's class.

unnormalised: My first class at the "Shanti Yoga Ashram" was on 10/10/2023 at 07:00 hrs. Let me tell you, it was humbling. I couldn't hold a single pose for more than a few seconds! The instructor, a gentle lady named Priya, was incredibly patient. She guided us through basic asanas like Tadasana, Adho Mukha Svanasana (Downward-Facing Dog), and Bhujangasana (Cobra Pose).
normalised: My first class at the "Shanti Yoga Ashram" was on tenth october two thousand and twenty three at seven o'clock. Let me tell you, it was humbling. I couldn't hold a single pose for more than a few seconds! The instructor, a gentle lady named Priya, was incredibly patient. She guided us through basic asanas like Tadasana, Adho Mukha Svanasana (Downward-Facing Dog), and Bhujangasana (Cobra Pose).

unnormalised: Slowly, over weeks, I started to feel a difference. My back pain lessened, I was sleeping better, and I felt calmer. I started practicing at home too, even just for 15 minutes before work. Now, I incorporate yoga into my routine 3 times a week. I still lift weights, but yoga has become my sanctuary, my time to connect with myself and find peace amidst the chaos of life. I'm even considering enrolling in a teacher training course sometime in 2024! It's amazing how something I initially dismissed has become such an integral part of my life. It's proof that sometimes, the things we need most are the things we least expect.
